CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 15, 1958, pg. 2, reads: "Does This Condition Exist in Other Neighborhoods? Liquor Control Board Should Exercise Better Judgment - One of the overlooked evils in some neighborhoods of Allegheny County is the location of taverns in close proximity to churches, schools and playgrounds. Although such establishments do not operate on Sundays, their presence and the conduct of some patrons prove annoying during the week....  Two Doors from Church..the other tavern not shown in upper right photograph."
TitMainTitle: Herron Avenue with Herron Hill five and dime store at 604, Castle Bar at 602, and Specks Market at 600, Hill District
